resources.string:
Travel Blog is an app for creating posts tagged with location and timestamp.
 
The full User Guide is on the web.
 
 Setup:
 Make sure Location Access is turned on on your Android device settings. For best performance, turn on both GPS Satellites and Wi-Fi and Mobile networks.
 
 The New Trip menu command starts a new trip. This will be the KML filename of the blog (located in /TravelBlog/ on your SD card).
 Click on New Post when you want to log your location. This brings up a new page where you can type a name and description. While you are typing, it finds your location. If you need to modify the location, you can later edit the location on a map.
 
 You can edit a post by clicking on it, and you can delete a post by long-clicking on a post and selecting the delete command. When editing you can edit the name and description, and optionally to edit the location of your post by clicking on the location coordinates.
 
 You can view your trip on a Google map on your device by choosing Map Trip from the menu. You can copy the KML blog file manually to do what you choose with it, or you can send it via email or wherever your device can send it to by choosing Send Trip from the menu.
 
 The Manage Trip menu brings up a sub-menu.
 It contains the following commands:
 Delete Trip to delete existing Trip files.
 
 Rename Trip to rename the currently opened Trip file.
 
 Use Send Feedback to email us any comments or suggestions. Comments go to a public mailing list.
 
 Happy travelling!

What's New
 
 Version 2.2.0
 * App widgets now available, to directly start the New Post editing screen. These can be installed on the home screen. Multiple widgets can be installed, each one configured to use a specific trip file or to always start New Post using the last opened trip.
 * User interface updates and bug fixes. Rename Trip command added under a new Manage Trips submenu. Editing screens now show the index of the post being edited.
 
 Version 2.0.1
 * Locations are now editable using a map. When editing a post, click on location text to bring up a map.
 
 * Clicking on blog entry in the main list now invokes the post editing screen.
 
 * Settings menu added for customizing app behavior.
 
 * Send feedback using email menu command added.
 
 Version 1.7
 * App is now open source.

Configure Widget
 
 Select an existing trip file or create a new trip file.
 
 After completing this install, clicking on the widget will start the New Post editing screen for the selected trip file.
